message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce the tower exactly as shown, using only the orientations provided in the “Block Dictionary” image.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET (MAIN) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Total Block Count and Layers
   – There are 10 total pieces.  
   – From bottom to top, you can think of the structure in roughly three “levels”:  
       1.  Three orange cylinders on the ground (two at the front, one at the back), plus a second orange cylinder stacked on top of the rear cylinder.  
       2.  A large yellow rectangular “platform” resting across the two front cylinders, with a “mini‐house” on top (red arch plus two yellow half‐cylinders).  
       3.  Two orange wedge “roofs”: one crowning the tall rear cylinder tower, and one atop the red arch.  

•  Spatial Arrangement
   – The front “legs” are two vertical orange cylinders, side by side.  
   – A single thick yellow rectangular block spans across these two front cylinders to form a floor or platform.  
   – Behind this platform is a tall orange “tower” made by stacking two vertical orange cylinders.  
   – On top of the yellow platform sits a small “house” composed of:  
       • A red arch block standing upright (arch opening downward).  
       • A yellow half‐cylinder nestled under that arch.  
       • A second yellow half‐cylinder directly behind the arch (creating a domed shape at the rear).  
       • A small orange wedge roof placed on top of that red arch.  
   – Finally, another orange wedge block sits on the very top of the tall orange cylinder tower.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING / LISTING THE REQUIRED DICTIONARY BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching the colors and orientations exactly as shown (no rotations allowed beyond what the dictionary provides), the following blocks are used (with repeats where needed):

• Block #8 (Orange Cylinder, vertical) → used 4 times  
  – Two form the front legs  
  – Two stacked to form the tall rear tower  

• Block #4 (Yellow Rectangular Block, horizontal) → used once  
  – Forms the large yellow platform spanning the front cylinders  

• Block #1 (Red Arch Block, arch opening downward) → used once  
  – Forms the red “house” arch  

• Block #10 (Yellow Half‐Cylinder) → used twice  
  – One half‐cylinder under the red arch  
  – One half‐cylinder at the rear of the arch  

• Block #16 (Orange Wedge/Roof, apex centered) → used twice  
  – One on top of the tall orange tower  
  – One on top of the red arch “house”

In short:
 – #8 × 4  
 – #4 × 1  
 – #1 × 1  
 – #10 × 2  
 – #16 × 2  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{  
   Step1: Move block with index 8   (place first orange cylinder at front left)  
   Step2: Move block with index 8   (place second orange cylinder at front right)  
   Step3: Move block with index 8   (place third orange cylinder at rear, forming tower base)  
   Step4: Move block with index 4   (lay the yellow rectangular platform across the two front cylinders)  
   Step5: Move block with index 8   (stack fourth orange cylinder atop the rear cylinder to extend the tower)  
   Step6: Move block with index 10  (place first yellow half‐cylinder under where the red arch will go)  
   Step7: Move block with index 10  (place second yellow half‐cylinder behind the arch location)  
   Step8: Move block with index 1   (set the red arch block over the half‐cylinders)  
   Step9: Move block with index 16  (place an orange wedge/roof on top of the red arch)  
   Step10: Move block with index 16 (set the second orange wedge/roof on top of the tall cylinder tower)  
}

Following the above sequence will reproduce the tower exactly as seen in the target image.
